conclusion: To find the magnitude and direction of the resultant Ampere force acting on the trapezoidal frame, we need to follow these steps:
The resistance R of a wire is given by: R = ρL/S.
The resistance of each side is R_ab = R_bc = R_cd = ρL/S.
The equivalent resistance R_parallel of ab and cd in parallel is ρL/2S.
The current I through the circuit is 2SE/3ρL.
The Ampere force on each side is F_ab = F_bc = F_cd = 2BSE/3ρ.
Using the right-hand rule, determine the direction of the forces.
F_ab and F_cd are perpendicular to the plane of the frame and directed inward. F_bc is perpendicular to the plane of the frame and directed outward.

premise: F_ab and F_cd are equal and opposite
F_ab and F_cd cancel out, F_bc = 2BSE/3ρ
conclusion: The resultant force is due to F_bc: F_resultant = 2BSE/3ρ.
The magnitude of the resultant Ampere force acting on the frame is 5BSE/3ρ, and the direction is vertically upward.
